column1: #Text=PART II.-RANNOCH THE MOOR OF RANNOCH Rannoch , which lies parallel with Fortingall , is about 28 miles in length ( i.e. , the Perthshire part of it ) but the moor stretches much further west and goes into Argyllshire .
#Text=It is at an elevation of 1000 feet above sea-level , and flanked by lofty mountains , which do not seem so high on account of their distance .
#Text=The moor of Rannoch is perhaps the most desolate tract of land in Scotland .

#Text=In the wildness of the mountains that rise steep and rugged from the shores of Loch Ericht , there is a weird grandeur which a recent writer has well described in the following lines : Around this vast tremendous solitude , Where nought is heard except the wild wind 's sigh , Or savage raven 's deep and hollow cry , With awful thought the spirit is imbued ; Around , around for many a weary mile , The Alpine masses stretch ; the heavy cloud- Cleaves round their brows , concealing with its shroud , Black , barren rocks unthawed by Summer 's smile , Nought but the desert mountains and lone sky Are here , birds not , and the wandering bee Searches for flowers in vain ; nor shrub nor tree Nor human habitation greets the eye Of heart-sick pilgrim ; while around him lie Silence and desolation , what is he !
